body:
What version of ZAP are you using?
Are you able to try this with a weekly? https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/wiki/Downloads#zap-weekly
Seems that happened using a weekly `ZAP_D-2017-07-17`. Worth taking a look at the log when that happens.

@kingthorin 
yes, i use the latest weekly version.just i used the 

Weekly - cross platform | 2017-10-02 | 279 MB .
and when i right click and choose "Open/Resend With Request Editor",it still can't work
Is there any error logged in zap.log file? Does that happen with all HTTP messages?

@thc202 

<sub>Edited: By @kingthorin 20171005 minor formatting tweak.</sub>
this happen on all HTTP messages

The offending code seems to be:
https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-extensions/blob/alpha/src/org/zaproxy/zap/extension/viewstate/HttpPanelViewStateView.java#L117
`vsInfoTxt.setFont(FontUtils.getFont("Courier", Font.BOLD));`

I read some posts that suggest "Courier New" is generally widely available and default. Other things suggest that the following would generally work `vsInfoTxt.setFont(Font.MONOSPACED, Font.BOLD));`
@kingthorin You mean there is no font like Courier in the system?

That seems to be Java's issue if you read the exception/code.

You could remove the Viewstate add-on, restart ZAP and see if Resend works.

That can also be achieved by just disabling the extension `ExtensionHttpPanelViewStateView`. [1] (It still requires the restart of ZAP though.)

[1] https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-core-help/wiki/HelpUiDialogsOptionsExt
@kingthorin yeah, use of `Font.MONOSPACED` is probably better, we still need to change core to fail gracefully when the font is not available though.
Can also reproduce the issue when using GTK L&F (with Nimbus it works fine).

rename.from: zap on mac can't open the Resend window
rename.to: Can't open the Resend window because of missing font
